page.title: 07THE RAILWAY.
page.content: At the beginning of this century Penistone was a busy railway centre at the junction of two lines Sheffield-Huddersfield (LMS) and Sheffield-Manchester (LNER) via the Woodhead Tunnel. The line to Manchester was one of the first in Brtain to be electrified because of the length of the tunnel. Now the railway is in decline much of the station is no longer in use,the line to Manchester is closed. Over the past 12 months the overhead power lines have been removed. The line from Penistone to Huddersfield is also under threat of closure. The service to Sheffield is quite popular and now runs through Barnsley. A station at Silkstone Common was opened on that line only last year.
